definition: to fall out with sb/to become hostile
variant of 翻[fan1]
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
face/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
to fall out with sb and become hostile

sentences.english: Because wang turned against apple shen heart of wang jian.
sentences.chinese: 因为王苹苹沈心对王建翻脸。

sentences.english: M MengFei turned again because with Chen.
sentences.chinese: 徐峰与孟菲因陈超再次翻脸。

sentences.english: Yet China quickly upended this consensus.
sentences.chinese: 然而中国很快就翻脸了。

sentences.english: If they break this sacred rule, you must turn upon them with the Wrath of Hell(tm).
sentences.chinese: 如果他们违反了这神圣的规定，就和他们翻脸吧。

sentences.english: The junior immediately turned his attention to the hardwood.
sentences.chinese: 初中马上翻脸不认他注意硬木。

sentences.english: What have I done to you? I declare that I am perplexed.
sentences.chinese: 我声明要翻脸了，你得和我言归于好。

sentences.english: WHEN your own lawyers turn on you, things must be serious.
sentences.chinese: 当你的律师也与你翻脸的时候，事态一定很严重。

sentences.english: YiMing finally decided to put KuErBan and Martha turned to query.
sentences.chinese: 伊明终于决定放了库尔班，并与前来质问的玛莎翻脸。

sentences.english: Cloud son also wrote a letter, brazen and left over the camp.
sentences.chinese: 云子也写了一封信，悍然与营左翻脸。

sentences.english: Eg : My girlfriend gets snippy when I tell her I'm going out with the boys .
sentences.chinese: 当我告诉女友要去和哥们出去时，她当既就翻脸了。

sentences.english: The best friend a man has in the world may turn against him and become his enemy.
sentences.chinese: 人在世界上最好的朋友可能会翻脸成仇。

definition: see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]

to have a falling out/to have a big argument

to start a feud/to become enemies
to offend

to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
to lay one's cards on the table
